title: What's the best TypeFace for this logo ?
content:
Hello

I’ve make logo for my site called “OrigamiArabia”  
and i’ve problem with the typeface of the logo and im loss  
beacuse i tried many types and i cant find a type consistent with the mark.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125730im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/2008-07-07_013001_5065.png)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [2008-07-07\_013001.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125730/http:/typophile.com/files/2008-07-07_013001.png) | 38.86 KB |

 [‹ Wanted: feedback on design and type choices](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125730/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47155 "Go to previous forum topic") [Questions about criteria for typeface design ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125730/http:/www.typophile.com/node/47162 "Go to next forum topic")
author: WhitGer

comments.content:
There are a few typefaces I would like for this mark...  
If taking the serif route I think a Hoefler Text Roman is always a good choice.

If considering a san serif, Sudtipos makes some great faces to match the angularity of this mark. Mr. Giacco and Politica are great faces, check them out.

[http://sudtipos.com/fonts/36](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125730/http:/sudtipos.com/fonts/36 "http://sudtipos.com/fonts/36")  
 [http://sudtipos.com/fonts/42](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125730/http:/sudtipos.com/fonts/42 "http://sudtipos.com/fonts/42")

There is also an interesting serif from adobe called Belwe

[http://store1.adobe.com/cfusion/store/html/index.cfm?store=OLS-US&event=...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125730/http:/store1.adobe.com/cfusion/store/html/index.cfm?store=OLS-US&event=displayFont&code=BELQ10006000 "http://store1.adobe.com/cfusion/store/html/index.cfm?store=OLS-US&event=displayFont&code=BELQ10006000")

Good luck!

i try these fonts with the logo:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125730im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/55555_4097.png)
Second from the bottom looks really nice

Don’t post the same thing in two different forums, please.

[http://typophile.com/node/47136#comment-288127](http://web.archive.org/web/20080905125730/http:/typophile.com/node/47136#comment-288127 "http://typophile.com/node/47136#comment-288127")

Yeah, second from the bottom is aesthetically pleasing for me. I would like to see the “camel” without strokes. I personally like the bottom version of the camel. Of course I don’t know any background info on the logo, so I’m just judging on what I see.
Second from the bottom is best for me too but I’d nudge the type closer to the camel.
